reviews.text: This review is a little tardy as we visited the resort in September, but because we had been there so many times, I was shocked at all the improvements in accomodations and service! We always liked the Coba, but this last visit was outstanding! Premium liquor available at all the bars, even the pool bar with Jaime, Ruperto and Angel. Geronimo and his staff at Gran Tortuga were amazing along with the food. The staff at Don Pablo's went the extra mile to make my friends birthday special. The new beds were great and maid service was wonderful. Two surprises, Rafael at the Seafood ala carte elevated the dining experience with his service. Daniel at the Mediterrean, however was not ready for "prime time" My husband and I are home based Travel Agents and love accompanying clients to Grand Bahia. We are off in a month to try the Esmeralda in Dominican Republic. I hope they can live up to the standards set by Felix and his staff!
reviews.title: Better than ever!

reviews.text: We stayed in the Coba bit of the Gran Bahia Principle complex in Xmas 2012 with 2 children (4 and 14 yrs, boys). The place was clean, the food was decent for a buffet, and the premises were all well kept and nice. However, going to this place you should bear in mind that it is a gated resort of industrial scale i.e. 8000 tourists in the middle of nowhere with its own shopping malls and poor connection to the outside world. So, basically you're there with all the other tourists sipping margaritas and you could be in Vegas just as well as in Mexico. We also had a room facing the motorway (so please specify you don't want this) and as a consequence we never used the balcony and it was noisy. Further the beach was a 15 minute golf cart ride away ( so saying it's on the beach is quite a stretch). Personally I would not recommend this resort or much any of the other on the Riviera Maya as it's such an industrial venture, which is also very bad for the local communities and the environment (they don't benefit from the tourism at all as all the money is spent inside these monstrous hotels).
reviews.title: mass tourism on industrial scale

reviews.text: I have gone to this resort 3 times now and each time I have seen it with different eyes.Each time was in December around the same time. The first time I was blown away with the resort and all its amenities, people etc. Second time not so much and the third time very disappointed.
reviews.title: gone down hill

reviews.text: They are doing time shares now and if you don't sign up you don't get the service that one should expect from a resort of this caliber. I saw it the first time...fantastic!! Now if you don't sign up you are herded like cattle to the less desirable seats on the beach where you have to hoof it to the bar way down the beach where the special people can walk 10 ft to their special bar...that you can not use but we were allowed to 2 years ago.But hey if you want...pay a lot of extra money..and you get to see what it used to be like...I wont be going back to that resort again.
reviews.title: 4 adults + 4 kids + a great resort

reviews.text: The service seems to be governed by the colour of your bracelet and it shows at times in the restaurants. We went all breakfast without so much as on waiter or waitress for coffee or juice...this only happened once happily. Repairs on the grass roofs is non existent ...instead...towels and signs everywhere on the floor.
reviews.title: Great resort

reviews.text: My husband and I and two other couples from Nova Scotia travelled to this wonderful resort in Feb 07. We travelled to DR, Cuba and to another resort in the Mayan Riviera last year. We loved the area and resort in the Mayan and it was a 4*. We would rate the BP tops on our list. Yes, as the previous reviews state, it is huge but it is absolutely spotless, lush and gorgeous. The rooms, restaraunts, lobbies, pools, etc were imaculate. We will be returning to this resort next February as we had our trip slightly interrupted this year. On day #2 at 7:30 in morning my husband slipped on the floor at the Akumal restaraunt (wet floors due to the tropical storm the night before) and he totally separated his collarbone and was rushed to the hospital, had surgery, and was released in time to go home. I won't elaborate on situation as living it is painful enough but my reason for mentioning this is to make people aware that they need to be careful on the floors at this resort. Prior to coming on this trip I did read about other people encountering slips and/or falls but really didn't pay much attention. The floors are cleaned and polished at night and we realize that with a little dampness or even beach sand they can become quite dangerous. The floors are beautiful and clean but my suggestion to the resort is that they invest in some runners to put down after a rain or showers to assist the people who are not accustomed to this danger. Again, we will be returning to the BP next February and due to circumstances beyond our control- February 2008 can't get here soon enough!
reviews.title: It is an outstanding resort
Five Star all the way!
reviews.text: We arrived at the resort and were treated with respect and kindness right away. The staff were more than willing to help with whatever we needed. We were late arriving because our flight from Saskatoon was an hour late leaving the minus 29 weather. Our bags were checked and delivered to our room.

reviews.title: the good and the bad
reviews.text: We were handed a wonderful drink to enjoy and given directions to our villa. The room was spectacular and the resort was lit up like Christmas in July.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next we headed to the buffet for a meal that was out of this world. The choices were endless and the food was impressive to look at and it tasted as great as it looked.
reviews.title: Great Time
Absolutely brilliant should be 7 star !
reviews.text: We stayed a week and were waited on by the nicest people who wanted to learn English as much as we wanted to learn Spanish.

This was the first time we have traveled as a family to an all inclusive resort. The cleanliness, service, and how the hotel is run as a whole is impeccable. Employees go above and beyond to make sure you are comfortable and enjoying your stay. We didn't do any a la carte dinners because the buffet had a great variety (two in the family are vegetarians). The only thing that wasn't the greatest was that the beach wasn't as close as we would have liked, but it is still very easily accessible (golf carts driving back and forth every 10 minutes, and it was only about a 4 minute walk. We would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking to travel to the Mayan Riviera. We would definitely book here again.
reviews.title: A christmas in paradise...

reviews.text: We stayed at the grand Bahia Principe Coba from December 19-26 as part of a group of 18 people in 4 families.
reviews.title: Second visit to this complex

reviews.text: On our prior trip to the Grand Bahia Prinicpe we stayed at the Akumal and the Coba compared more favourably.
reviews.title: First time all inclusive, and not last.

reviews.text: Our check in was simple even though our flight was delayed and we did not arive until midnight. We had requested 2 side by side rooms by email and we did receive them. No request that we had was ever a problem. As a group of 18 the restaurant staff were sometimes required to make special arangements for seating and times at the a la cartes and they did so efficiently and cheerfully. The buffet food was above average for that type of food and the a la carte food was very good. We found the staff overall very friendly and helpful at all times. The resort and rooms were very clean tidy and in good repair. No complaints at all about most of the facilities or staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would like to single out Sergio and Betty of the activity staff who were excellent. Sergio noticed our teenage daughter dancing at the outside dance floor and approached my wife to invite our daughter to be in some of the evening shows as they had a dancer missing and needed a ballet part filled. Our daughter rehersed with the choreographer Betty the dancers and performed small parts in two shows and said all the dancers were all extremely nice and helful. It was a highlight for sure for a teenage dancer from Canada to perform and be accepted by the staff there.
reviews.title: Unbelievably Good Time on The Mayan Riviera

reviews.text: Stayed at the Bahia Principe Coba for two weeks, starting the last week in August. Our family has stayed numerous times at the resort and are VIP guests. We usually stayed in the Akumal section but thought we would give Coba a try this visit.
reviews.title: Fantastic time at Bahia Principe Coba

reviews.text: As frequent guests, the PR manager was kind enough to book all the a la carte restaurants in advance by email. In addition, we received welcome bottles of champagne and nightly treats that were well appreciated.
reviews.title: Amazing, Fantastic,Even more than expected

reviews.text: The experience was just as we had come to expect over the years. Last year the occupancy was low and some restaurants were shut down at times. This year the occupancy has rebounded and the resort was full, except for the last few days.
reviews.title: Fantastic time at Coba

reviews.text: Coba has newer and better rooms, but the location means that it is a trek to the beach. However, we did walk to most places and found it a good way to burn off the calories. The trolleys could have been more frequent for those wishing to ride them.
reviews.title: A really nice hotel, shame about the wine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Entertainment at the Coba pool appeared to be good but we were not there much. We had seen all the shows in the past, but they were entertaining to see again. One wish is to have more dancing in the evenings, even while shows are going on as an alternative. There were bands playing at some venues but few people danced.
reviews.title: Great hotel but Europeans over run the Place.

reviews.text: Before I booked at the Gran Bahia Principe Coba resort, I spent quite a bit of time going through the reviews on this site so I thought I would return the favor and add my 2 cents for people deciding if they should book or not.
reviews.title: Great vacation - would go back tomorrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent 1 week at this resort with my wife and 2 teens - we loved it. I would return tomorrow in a heart beat.
reviews.title: AMAZING HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is huge - but this is not necessarily a bad thing. We enjoyed the option of going from resort to resort and trying the different pools and services available at the different hotels. It was like having 3 vacations in 1 so we were never bored - 1 day at Coba, 1 day at Tulum, 1 day at Akamal - wonderful. We were impressed with the cleanliness of the property - there is literally an army of people working hard from sun rise to sun set to make sure everything was perfect. The food was very good - no complaints from any of us and no one got sick. All in all, an excellent vacation that was well worth the cost. I have seen negative comments from some posters but don't be deterred - this resort has something for everyone from the ones looking for a relaxing spot to lounge around to the ones looking for a party and lots of activities. Yes, there are all types of animals wandering the grounds - we saw iguanas, monkeys and other types of animals we were exactly sure what they were but that's part of the vacation isn't it? You are in Mexico after all not in downtown New York or Toronto or Vancouver - if you are ready to accept this once you get to your hotel, you will enjoy all that this resort has to offer.
reviews.title: loved the hotel....other guests need lessons in good manners!

reviews.text: It was a amazing resort! The staff were lovely, the service was amazing they treat you like a queen ... i have not one bad thing to say about the hotel and the staff, the food, the pool, the beach .... it was just great! Perfect for couples and familys. I have been telling all my friends to go there. You would not be upset with this hotel. Do not believe the bad reviews ... they must be very stuck up people ... it is 100% a 5 star hotel! You want for nothing while you are there. The complex is huge! Enjoy x
reviews.title: Perfect, relaxing - 4th visit!!! DO NOT BELIEVE BAD REVIEWS!!! BRITS were well behaved!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from gbp and loved the Coba hotel. It is kept extremely clean as is the grounds and bedrooms or "villas" as they are known.Also the food at the coba buffet restaurant is really nice and cooked really well , the choice is huge and we never got bored,No upset tummy either!The drinks that are served are quite weak but hey ho they were ok and the banana daiqiri was heavenly. The beach at the coba is picturesque and the sea is warm and clear. the shuttlebus that takes you to the beach is a bonus as it was extremely hot and humid when we arrived. Now they are all the positives that i can think of about our holiday.The negatives far outweigh the positives!!!! the reason being other guests !I have never been to a place where other guests are rude,ignorant selfish neanderthals! Are we british the only people that know the meaning of Queing and fairness???? Too many incidents to list here but believe me there are a few.Tipping is next on my hitlist! Yes it is fair to tip if you receive good service but you shouldnot be made to feel as though you should tip for EVERY service. This was the feeling we got anyway waiters hung around us at every oppertunity also the maid and the guy who refilled our fridge! Our holiday money is hard earned and we do not travel thousands of miles just to give it away!Definately a good tip i picked up off T.A was to take a travel cup they kept drinks lush and cool and came in handy for the drinks at the beach after we witnessed some of the plastic gflasses that drinks were served in being kicked around the beach and also used as ashtrays then just rinsed and then driks served in them. Next is the entertainment....or lack of it. karaoke in spanish live music at Hacienda in spanish , spanish night at the theater need i go on. Guess we should have learnt the lingo! Overall we did enjoy our holiday and the TCP was a mint night out thanx Kareem we had a blast., but dont think i would go back to this hotel and may i just finish by saying i really am proud to be British!!
reviews.title: Stay Away!! (Unless you like flying roaches!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from one week at the Gran Bahia Principe Coba. I've never written a review on Trip Advisor before, but I use this site all the time to make my travel decisions,so I thought it about time I contribute back. I'll try to be as objective as possible.
reviews.title: Good for the most part ...but !

likes.liked: — Very clean, linens were great, good sized room.

reviews.text: This is our 8th trip to Mexico and our 5th time to that general area between Cancun and Tulum. I love Mexico and the people there are so very nice and friendly.
reviews.title: Two Thumbs Up For Good Holiday Fun!

likes.liked: — 5 star quality, immaculately clean and tidy, good service
likes.disliked: — Red wine does not taste good!

reviews.title: Piece of Paradise!
reviews.text: The resort Is beautiful and the complex is hugh. We're both healthly and have no problems walking anywhere, but it just seemed like lots of walking for no real purpose. Passing the same buildings and grounds wandering for your restaurant. I've come to the conclusion for me anyway that I will never go to these massive resorts again. We've done it a couple times now and my opinion is smaller is better. It's more personal and you get to know the staff and other guests more easily which adds to your enjoyment. I also think service is better in a smaller resort.
The grounds are very well maintained and beautiful I don't think anyone could find complaint there.
reviews.title: What an amazing resort!!
Wonderful Vacation
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and spacious. I thought the bed linens were great.

Six of us traveled to the GBH Coba on December 5, 2012. Ranging in age from 14-45. We all had a great time. The hotel, restaurants, room and grounds were all kept immaculate. It was amazing to see all the different animals wandering around the resort. The food was excellent! We had no complaints about our vacation. It can be a challenge communicating with some staff, but we feel that is expected and having been trying to work on our Spanish. The location is perfect for so many of the different attractions available. If you wanted to spend your hole vacation on the resort there is plenty to do and see without going on tours. The Tulum ruins were impressive and worth the tour and snorkeling with the sea turtles in their natural habit was a memory of a life time. Some of our group took a taxi into Playa de Carmen and felt completely safe and enjoyed the shopping. There is a large selection of stores on site at GBP as well. All and all we highly recommend this hotel. Be ready to get your exercise it is big, the carts come around regular but can get very busy.
reviews.title: Huge Resort, Great Vacation

reviews.text: We stayed at the Gran Bahia Principe Coba from December 15th to December 24th with our two kids of 7 and 8 yo.
reviews.title: Our best holiday so far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM : We had a room in villa 7 and it was really calm we were able to go to sleep quite early, and never heard any noise from outside. We didn’t find any musty smell, just a normal tropical country smell. The maid always did our room early and made cute towel animals. Mini-bar was restocked every day. The bathroom was also very nice.
reviews.title: highly recommend this resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: RESTAURANTS : We mainly eat at the Kukulcan buffet. Our favorite waitress was Juana Maria Pech Herrera, she was there for breakfast and lunch and she was really nice. She was always smilling and she was providing a very good service and she is efficient too. Food was nice, plenty to choose from, deserts were really good too. We went to the Akumal buffet once since we were at the beach near it. It was so crowded, we didn’t repeat… We also went to the Grand Tortuga and it was fantastic. Food and service were excellent.
reviews.title: First time at all-inclusive resort in Rivera Maya.

reviews.text: BEACH : For us it was perfect. Fishes, no waves, not too much rocks, plenty of chairs. DO NOT FEED THE FISHES! There is a lot of signs and people still feed them. We even saw a teenage girl with her parents feeding them on Choco-Krispies.
reviews.title: Beyond words

reviews.text: Apple's "Destination I Do" program gave our group great rates and a rebate to the bride for every person booked. Fernanda, the hotel Wedding Coordinator, handled every detail and made this the easiest wedding we have ever had in the family. From flowers, cake, music and the wedding dinner, she managed every detail. Our group of 32 was transported from the hotel lobby to the beautiful wedding pergola on the edge of the ocean. Fernanda provided rose petals to throw at the couple after the ceremony and champagne. The wedding photographer was amazing. The wedding dinner at the Mediterrean restaurant was incredible. The hotel staff decorated the bride and grooms suite with balloons, towel sculptures and flowers. Our group loved the whole thing. While we didn't have a picky bride - this is the way to have a wedding - fun for all!
reviews.title: Destination Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival at the gran bahia we expected to arrive at akumul lobby as that is what we paid for instead we were taken to coba lobby to find that we had been upgraded to a junior suite which was fantastic! first impressions of the grounds the hotel etc.. was very high, could not believe how big the hotel actually was, alot bigger than we expected , but this was a good thing, meaning lots to do and lots of places to explore.!!
reviews.title: AMAZING HOLIDAY!!

reviews.text: Room was big and spacious and the bed was a huge kingsize, the maid service was fantastic and very clean, fridge was always filled with water which was great for days out etc.. and it was nice to go back to the room to see what towel animal the maid had made for us, also unlike what some people have said about the air-conditioning , we found it to be a life saver! we left the air conditioning on full when we left the room in the morning and when we came in from a long day on the beach it was cool and refreshing, infact i was too cold.. haha!
reviews.title: Your vacation is what you make of it!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD: Oh my god!! we can not fault the food in any way at all, breakfast was out of this world, with the buffett having a wide variety of foods to choose from, the egg station being the best, the staff work so hard and stil manage to give you a smile with your favourite omelette in the morning. :) Dinner time we ate at coba buffett as well as tulum and akumul, and both have a wide variety but i think that coba is alot bigger and not as difficult to find somewhere to sit. We had 8 A la Carte restaurants to book as we got upgraded, we visited Portofino, don pablo, mikado, gran tortuga, mediterraneo, and tequila... all fantastic with great service!
reviews.title: Fantastic time, great hotel

reviews.text: Entertainment in the evenings was good, always a show on everynight, after that you can head down to the hacienda where there is bars and shops, and then there is a 'discoteque' open from 1230am -230am for all those that want to have a late night.
reviews.title: Great place, if you like getting Salmonella poisoning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled to this resort on 7th -21st june just got over the jet lag,what can i say this hotel is brilliant,unbelievably clean, The rooms are large and spacious, and the food is Excellent we were put in the Coba side of the resort overlooking the quiet pool which suited us fine,most days we stuck to our pool but made use of the train service and went to the Coba Beach on a few days, when we read reviews about the Coba not being on the beach i was a bit concerned but theres no need to worry at all,the trains are running all the time till 3am and will stop and pick you up anywhere on the complex we waited no longer than a couple of mins at anytime.You can get to any of the other hotels,beach,or lobbys and if you want to get off just shout hola and he will drop you anywhere,even outside your block. Apparently its not far to walk to the beach but we were too idle as it was very hot Thats the only complaint we had if someone could have turned down the temp a notch or two it would have been great !! We made use of our full quota of the A La Cartes and went to the Meditaranio, Le Gormet, La torruga, Dolce vita, and mikado but our favorite was the le gormet so we went twice!!!they were all good but was dissapointed with the Torruga as they brought you a small piece of meat at a time and was kept waiting a good 10 mins befor they brought you another piece of meat of a different type theres a card system in place red on one side green on the other when you have had enough meat you turn the card to red none of ours was on red and they came and took our plates away ...we went away with another couple who were as pleased with our choice of hotel as we were, Everything was brilliant,The place is spotlessly clean and the staff are allways smiling,In the main Coba Resturaunt every morning theres cereal ( kelloggs ) for the fussy ones, bacon,eggs,mushrooms ect as well as continental stuff, coffee, orange juice,Tequilla,vodka,Champagne Yes!!!! every morning for those who wanted it . Anyone who finds anything to complain about at this resort must have something wrong with them !!! We have stayed in all inclusives in Jamaica, Cuba,St Lucia ect and this was by far the best hotel. We didnt go on any trips with the reps but got a taxi and went to Ackumal Beach and swam with the turtles and Rays it was marvellous the had our lunch at a beach front resturant down there..sorry cant remember name of place but it was really good and the size of portions were enormous we also got a taxi to Playa Del Carmen to 5th avenue it cost 60 usd but the driver took us waited 3hrs for us then drove us back he was brill well worth it as there was 4 of us We would deffinatly recommend this resort we had a lovely holiday!!!! if anyone wants to E.mail me please feel free.
reviews.title: Wow !!!! What a Resort !!!!!
Great Resort!
reviews.text: I was here for a vacation in January 2010. I loved the resort and the staff were great! I highly recommend the "Party Hopper" bar crawl when you visit Playa del Carmen. I will come back to this resort again.

Disappointed with the entertainment staff on this return trip to bahia coba.......The staff was not very friendly and generally wanted to pick up the young girls and not bothered with doing anything else .Water exercise was a horrible experience and my group went everyday hoping it would get better but that didn't happen...Games and other activity never started anywhere close to posted times.Its very clear that the group has very poor leadership from the manager of this group.Sorry to see it because the group use to be the best in the area.... HOPE THIS HELPS TO MAKE POSITIVE CHANGES.
reviews.title: Entertainment staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just arrived back from the Gran Bahia Principe COBA and I have got to say it is was the most amazing holiday I have ever been on. Everybody made you feel so special.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing

reviews.text: We got a free upgrade when we booked with First Choice as a special offer and it was ace! Although you wouldnt need it as you would enjoy it all the same.
reviews.title: Best Holiday So far
Nice, but too big
reviews.text: This hotel is very nice and very impressed by it's cleanliness. I won't repeat what other reviews say, but I will say that I never had a bad experience at all! No bugs, mold, or anything else. The hotel was spotless and I am very picky about that. My only complaint is the size. I don't mind large resorts, but this one is EXTREMELY large and you can't expect to get anywhere quick. We used the dive shop and they were very nice as well. Wouldn't rec the Bahia Ranch for horseback riding though. Not very exciting but our kids did enjoy it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was very good and my kids and I are rather picky. All the al la cartes were excellent. I did 2 of our reservations through email and they were waiting for us when we got there.
reviews.title: non stop entertainment to enjoy and relaxing if wanted

reviews.text: The beds were fine with the mattress pad. The air conditioning wasn't effective at all in cooling down the room. It was a hot week there.
reviews.title: Wow! Loved it!

reviews.text: We don't usually go back to the same place twice, but this resort is so big it would discourage me from returning.
reviews.title: WOW! Wonderful time

reviews.text: We had a wonderful trip and the price we paid was great!
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel.........but.........
best vacation yet!
reviews.text: We stayed at Gran Bahia Coba the week of Valentines Day. The hotel and staff by far exceded my expectations. I couldn't have asked for better service. We arrived on a Saturday and were checked in within minutes. The room was fantastic, but make sure you close the balcony/patio door or the air won't kick on! We left $2US for room service each day and $2US for the mini bar. The fridge was stocked everyday and housekeeping even folded our clothes!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food. Oh my, was is good!!!! Out of all the restraunts, buffets, and 24hour snack bars we ate at the only one we didn't quite enjoy was the Japanese. The presentation was wonderful but the food didn't live up to the show. Everything else was so good. Even at 3am the Snack Bar had a good spread. I recommend the Kulkulkan(sp?) Buffet for dinner. i was never disappointed for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
reviews.title: Probably the best holiday we've ever had
Wonderful vacation at the Bahia
reviews.text: The drinks. Not bad at all. You can find Absolute, Jim Beam, Smirnoff, Malibu, Johnny Walker...ask for the brand specifically, not all the bars carry the topper shelf brands. The beer is good too. Can't go wrong with XX Dos Equis. As for the Tequilla, ask for anything but Jose. They carry much better!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach. From Coba its not a long walk as much as a confusing walk. i could find no signs pointing the way!!!!! we found it our first night at 2am!!!! But they do have the lobby cars. the one is marked Beach, take it if you don't feel like hunting!!! their stretch of beach is great from the sand, to the coral, to the rocky area. some areas are crowed others are not (coral/rocky areas).
reviews.title: Wonderful Coba. Just the ticket!!

reviews.text: We went to Playa del Carmen and Cozumel twice. We were told to take a taxi. it was $28US one way. we took the Collectivo $2US per person one way. its their form of public transportation. it stops all along 307 picking up tourists and workers. you get dropped off on 2nd and 15th in playa. go back there when you are ready to leave the van will come. go to the Hacienda and walk to the road, the vans are white and have a red or green or yellow(?) stripe on them. if you cross the road they will take to south to Tulum.
reviews.title: Pack up and go
Great family fun
reviews.text: Overall, great fun for our family of 6. Rooms were adjoining, which I loved for security! Huge resort, with something for everyone. Only thing missing was a teen focus, which left my teens disappointed. The activity staff however, was very fun, and included my teens (except in the beer drinking contest!!!!) My teens just met people on their own. We would return any time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really had a wonderful time here. At first I wasn't sure....but once I got to know my way around it was so fun! We were close to the smaller pool, and liked the quietness there. The iguanas were friendly and the croaties so cute. On a cool day we took advantage of the bikes... and did some sight seeing. We went shopping in the area, but also took a collectivo into Tulum for some adventure. If you go to the main road they are usually around.
reviews.title: Beach lovers paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a taxi to Paradise Beach where we body surfed the waves and marvelled at the powder soft sand. It is worth going to. You can see the Tulum ruins from there, but to get to the ruins you'd need another route.
reviews.title: A beautiful resort and a great trip -- our third to Bahia Principe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also took a taxi to Akumal Beach to snorkel with the turtles, some stingray, and fish. You can rent gear there for snorkeling. There was some exciting kite surfing going on there too.
reviews.title: Wish we could've stayed longer!!!!!

reviews.text: Always make sure that you agree on a price for the taxi before you go....
reviews.title: Annual family trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well what can I say.. Food Amazing, people great and the resort was to die for...
reviews.title: AMAZING TIME!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only have a few suggestions for the hotel, however not major.... When we came in to the hotel it was very confusing for us.. The front deskl staff wasn't very helpful.. It was late, we were hungry... The trolleys are confusing.. Needless to say I was upset the first night.. But once the day came, we (husband & I) we rode the trolleys from 1 resort to the other and we found our way around.. I think the front desk needs to explain things a little better and take into consideration that we don't know where the food is, (We were hungry from our trip) and maybe give us a little more guidance...
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we enjoyed our stay... Plenty to do and see... suggestions if your going to go off resort... Tulum to be exact.. Catch the collectivos out at the Hwy and take those in.. Quicker and cheaper (3$ US, and you don't have to waste a day (only an hr) at the ruins checking it out.
reviews.title: A great honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: YOu can also take the clectivos into Playa del Carmen (3$ us). They run until 9pm at night..
reviews.title: Amazing time! I will definitely return!

reviews.text: If you are deciding to stay at this resort.. I would look towards Tulum or Akumal if you want to be closer to the beach. Coba is the furthest from the beach.
reviews.title: To Busy, Over booked
Even better the second time!!
reviews.text: This is the second time that my wife and I have been to the Coba in the last 3 months. We stayed there in December of 2006 and most recently spent a week there from February 16-23, 2007. Both times we stayed at the Club Royal Golden provided by Air Transat. By clicking on my profile you can read my previous review.

We travel at least twice a year to various destinations and have never stayed at the same resort twice…until now. We figured that the Coba was clean and the food was very good that we could not go wrong by returning here. We also traveled with my in-laws and they really enjoyed this resort as well. This resort is not for the university party crowd. It is good for all ages and families who want a quiet relaxing holiday.
reviews.title: great place but beware

likes.disliked: — too big! gardener with chainsaw at 8 am!!

reviews.title: Amazing trip - too short a time
reviews.text: The food at the Coba is most definitely the best all inclusive food that we have had. We have about 10 AI’s to compare it with. As in our first trip nobody got sick, not even an upset stomach! The a-la-carte restaurants were very good. We ate at the Japanese, Oriental, Mexican and Mediterranean. The buffets were also good. We never had trouble finding something to eat and the food was not cold as others have claimed to experience.

The beach at this resort is nice….not as good as Punta Cana but good enough to relax and enjoy the sun. There is some good snorkeling to be had which includes feeding the fish off the dock at the Coba beach. There were always beach chairs available, you just had to walk further down the beach depending what time you got there. There are plenty of beach huts if you don’t wish to bake out in the sun! Also bring water shoes with you. The beach can be rocky in places.
reviews.title: Fell in Love

likes.disliked: — There was a long lineup at check-in as we all came in at once!

reviews.title: Kudos to Coba!!!
reviews.text: The pools were very refreshing and clean. Around the main pool there was music and different contests during the day. The other pool with the padded chairs was very quiet, the only problem is that you need to be at this pool before 7am to get a chair. We found that there were chairs available around 3pm after having spent the day at the beach. There are also 2 or 3 smaller Jacuzzi type pools with small bars for drinks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived for a 2 week holiday at the resort on 15th June 2010.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort - Shame so far away from the Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We(me, my wife and our 19 year old niece) travelled with First Choice (Part of TUI) on a ThomsonFly B767 First Choice aircraft. Flight excellent. First Choice configuration of the aircraft is so much better for economy with a 2-3-2 seating config which give more room than the Thomson ones we have been on which have been 2-4-2. (Seats a bit wider.)
reviews.title: Enjoyable and relaxing, wonderful staff

reviews.text: We knew that we had a 90 min trip from the airport scheduled on a bus but after being on the plane for 11 hours and then having to wait 40 mins on the bus before we departed and the trip taking 2 1/4 hours by the time we dropped off people at other hotels it made the journey a bit of a drag and we were not looking forward to the return trip being the same. That to be said, we haid a strong tail wind on the ay back which turned the 11 hour flight into a 8.5 hour which was good and more used to the one we have going to and from the Dominican Republic which has been our regular holiday location the past 10 years. THIS WAS THE ONLY REAL DOWNSIDE TO THE HOLIDAY except for Tropical Storm Alex which gave us bad weather for the last 5 days of our holiday but this time of year you can always expect that I guess.
reviews.title: Beautiful but a few issues.

reviews.text: First Choice gave us a free upgrade of our room because we booked early to Gold Club. This is good because it gives you a few extras in the room if you want to use them like Iron, Slippers and Gown and also a Jacuzzi bath. Additionally it gives you an extra A la Carte restaurant choice per week (4) instead of the usual 3. We had 2 rooms which were just across the landing from each other which we requested from the tour operator so this was great (I was expecting to have to negotiate a change when we checked in as usually requests seem to get ignored!!). The only downside to this free upgrade is that we were then based in the Coba Hotel which is the only one of the three that is not actually on the beach requiring you to catch a hotel shuttle there. This was the only downside because I love the beachbut to be honest could not be bothered to get on the shuttle all the time to go from the nice quiet pool in the Coba (our usual base) to the beach. My wife is not bothered with the beach, so most holidays we have we usually find a quiet spot by the pool under a palm umbrella that is within easy walking of the beach so I can go sailing and snorkeling. Being at the Coba this is not posible as it is not on the beach. I still made it though a few times to snorkel and thouroughly enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Your Best Bet for an All-Inclusive in the Riviera Maya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The snorkeling at the beach is the best of any hotel we have stayed at in Spain, Dom Rep or Mexico. The water was just so clear you could see for miles and I have taken a lot of film and phtos of the fish. You are a bit restricted where you can swim because of the rocks/coral but it is still very nice. I was a bit worried because people mentioned the manmade sand bars that are laid in the water to stop sand errosion. We had visited the Bahia Principe San Juan (Dom Rep) a few years ago and these were really obtrusive and spoilt the view of the sea. These are not like that at all and are almost unoticeable. I did not do much Catermeran sailing here though which was a shame as this is usually a mainstay of my holiday. The reason for this was the location of the Watersports centre. By the time I got the shuttle from the Coba hotel in the heat, andthen walked the 300 metres or so along the beach to the Watersports centre then to be told that I had to come back in a couple of hours or the next day because no Cat was available I was knackered. Other hotels I have been at (including the Bahia Principe chain), you can book a day or two in advance and al;o a couple of bookings so that you know you can sail when you arrive. Not here though, you can only book on the same day. Something they could improve.
reviews.title: The best vacation ever!!!

reviews.text: Overall we enjoy our stay at Coba and have received excellent services from staffs there. The windows are clean daily in our room and different animal made by towel are placed on our bed eveyday. The waiter and waitress quickly clear the finished plates off the table and always asking us if we need anything else. They worked so fast that you can hear them droping utensils or glass quite regularly.
reviews.title: The Coba beach is topless

reviews.text: It was quite suprising for us traveling with a kid to see topless sunbather walking around. You see some topless sunbather at coba beach.
reviews.title: too big, too impersonal, but beautiful resort.

reviews.text: There are many occasions that I almost ran into other people with a full plate of food in my hands. Other travellers just jump infront of you or budding in front of line. Before the shuttle bus arrive there seem to be a line up but as soon as the bus come everyone is for themselves? especially the trip from Akumal and Tulum back to Coba.
reviews.title: Been 4 times this year and already planning to go back

reviews.text: The best beach is at Coba where if you snorkle you can see fishes there but bring a water shoes because it is not sandy but rather a bit rocky there. There other beaches (Tulum and Akumal) are very windy with strong waves.
reviews.title: Good Holiday but with reservations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay at villa 27A and was able to get Wifi internet from our room with a long external USB Wifi antenna. Wifi internet are free at all lobby area.
reviews.title: Just OK, we will not be back.
